childMarkdownRemark.html: Candy Blissett; Robert Lippok; Rattenjunge & Blade Ronny (aka Chi Chimini | Mattow)
The second edition of our regular sound night event series.

Avant-garde German visual artist and composer Robert Lippok has been an influential player in Berlin’s thriving experimental music scene from a very early age. In 1983, he co-founded dissident punk band Ornament und Verbrechen with his brother Ronald, inspired by industrial trailblazers Throbbing Gristle. An open platform to explore jazz, electronic, and industrial concepts with like-minded collaborators of the East German underground persuasion, the group remained active until the mid-1990s, at which point it was overtaken by the brothers’ next and most well-known collaboration, the palindromic To Rococo Rot. A significant post-rock/electronic outfit started by the Lippok brothers and Düsseldorf bass guitarist Stefan Schneider, the Krautrockish band ushered in a new generation of electronic acts committed to acoustic investigations and improvisation of all stripes. Known for his expansive imagination, inventive rhythmic reflexes, and layers of fuzzy tones, Lippok’s solo work is just as wide-ranging – from funky, glitch-y, twisted techno record Redsuperstructure for Raster-Noton (2011), to stage design for operas, gallery exhibitions, and notable collaborations with Italian harpist Beatrice Martini, Canadian percussionist Debashis Sinha or brother Ronald and Italian composer Ludovico Einaudi (the latter trio as Whitetree).

Candy Blissett creates a genre of post-political entertainment for listeners both on and offline. She was formally known as VONVERHILLE and PUNK IS DADA. Their soundscape poetics/ audio essays have featured heavily in Omsk Social Club's installations over the last few years in both art institutions and project spaces globally, such as The Migros Museum (Zurich), Gold+Beton (Cologne), Middlesbrough Modern Art Museum (UK) Exgirlfriend (Berlin) and Center (Berlin).

Rattenjunge & Blade Ronny (aka Chi Chimini | Mattow) play music throughout the genres. Started with violent electronic music, now they also hunt in the fields of Punk, Rap, Footwork, Trap and Schlager. Pushing boundaries of modern music with producing songs as part of the Trap-Punk-Crew Schmutzige Teenager.
